disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents?

disobedience.question: Did you reject Church unity when frustrated with individuals within?

disobedience.question: Did you engage in unnecessary work on a Sunday, thus disrespecting the Lord's Day of rest?

greed.question: Did I make acquiring wealth and material possessions the driving force in my life, leading to idolizing them over God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Did I make acquiring and possessing material goods my primary source of comfort and security?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

oppression.question: Did you use your power, authority, or position to unjustly mistreat others?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: rather than seeing them in their full humanity
lust.question: Did I reduce others to their usefulness for me, rather than seeing them in their full humanity?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

extracted_data_phrases: to what they could do for me ,
rather than seeing them as full human beings created in God 's image
as full human beings created in God 's image
lust.question: Have I reduced others to what they could do for me, rather than seeing them as full human beings created in God's image?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted the good things in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my daily life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted God's blessings in my accomplishments, forgetting to acknowledge His hand in my successes?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I secretly compared my own blessings to those of others, feeling envious and discontent for their good fortune?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that used vulgar or inappropriate language
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others in a way that used vulgar or inappropriate language, offending their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: to others , especially those in my household and community
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others, especially those in my household and community, with vulgar or inappropriate language?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in a manner that was unbecoming of my Christian values and lack self - control , using language that was coarse or inappropriate
incontinence.question: Did I speak to others in a manner that was unbecoming of my Christian values and lack self-control, using language that was coarse or inappropriate?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking, especially when it came to sweets or other treats, that was more than reasonable?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: to overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did you allow your desire for comfort and relaxation to lead you to overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.question: Have I shared others' confidential matters, even if what I said was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing private details about friends , acquaintances , or family members
about friends , acquaintances , or family members
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing private details about friends, acquaintances, or family members?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I used words to discuss others' faults, even if what I said was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.
